definition: an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth (idiom)/fig. to use the enemy's methods against him/to give sb a taste of his own medicine
pinyin: yi3 yan3 huan2 yan3 , yi3 ya2 huan2 ya2

definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
